newsitem.title: USA: CSCE to raise margins on "C" coffee futures.
newsitem.headline: CSCE to raise margins on "C" coffee futures.

text.p: The Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange Inc said Tuesday it will raise margins on the March 1997 "C" coffee contract by $500, to $5,000, effective February 19.
Margins on May 1997 "C" coffee contracts will be increased by $1,000, to $4,000, the exchange said in a statement.
The CSCE said margins on all other coffee contracts will be raised by $500, to $3,000.
The changes come on the heels of two margin increases in February. Last week, the exchange raised the the March margins by $1,000.

In addition, CSCE said that as of February 19 it will increase trade margins on all straddle and arbitrage transactions between the March 1997 and May 1997 contracts by $500, to $4,000. Margins on all other straddle and arbitrage transactions involving the May 1997 contract will increase by $500 to $2,000.
For customers who are not exchange members or a member of the trade, margins will be 140 percent above trade rates, CSCE said.
